decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana and tutoring for key combo pieces to quickly bring out Primeval Titan and trigger landfall abilities to overwhelm opponents. By utilizing Amulet of Vigor to untap lands and bounce lands back to hand, the deck aims to generate a large amount of mana and chain together powerful card interactions to quickly win the game. The inclusion of various lands with unique abilities and the ability to search for specific lands with cards like Scapeshift and Summoner's Pact make this deck versatile and explosive in its gameplay.

This deck focuses on utilizing combo pieces such as Underworld Breach, Grinding Station, and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to generate infinite loops and win conditions. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble provide card advantage and graveyard recursion, while Mox Amber and Mox Opal help to ramp up mana quickly. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces and quickly mill or deal damage to the opponent using the various cards in the deck. The deck aims to win the game efficiently while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. By deploying threats like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares, the deck looks to close out the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted. The inclusion of cards like Dismember and Fatal Push provide flexibility in dealing with different types of threats, while cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Consider help to dig for key cards and maintain card advantage. The deck aims to control the game tempo and outvalue the opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing a variety of unique spells and creatures to quickly assemble a powerful combo involving Goblin Charbelcher and other cards to deal significant damage to the opponent. Without relying on traditional mana sources such as lands, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up its own win condition through a mix of control elements and combo pieces. By carefully managing resources and leveraging the synergies between cards, the deck can create explosive plays and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to respond.

The main concept of the deck is to aggressively disrupt the opponent's game plan while also establishing a strong board presence with creatures that have powerful abilities. By utilizing cards like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp to blink creatures and disrupt opponents, along with removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Fatal Push, the deck aims to control the battlefield. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Relic of Progenitus to disrupt graveyard strategies and Thoughtseize to further disrupt the opponent's hand. Ultimately, the deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and disruption.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It includes powerful cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to push through damage. It also includes disruptive elements like Goblin Bombardment and Static Prison to control the game. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast, efficient aggro strategy while also having some flexibility with cards like Ranger-Captain of Eos and Thraben Charm for additional utility. It emphasizes speed and efficiency in closing out games.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while efficiently applying pressure through aggressive creatures. It utilizes removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Fatal Push to deal with threats, along with disrupting their hand through Thoughtseize. The deck also has a strong flicker engine with cards like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp, allowing for repeated value from enter the battlefield effects. The creatures in the deck are versatile and can provide different types of disruption, making it difficult for the opponent to stabilize. The mana base is set up to support the aggro strategy while also providing access to different colors for the deck's varied spells.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through various ramp spells and removal, eventually ramping into powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. It also utilizes cards like Karn, the Great Creator to disrupt opponent's strategies and lock down the game. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats while controlling the board with removal spells and disruptive effects.
Overall, the deck aims to quickly ramp into powerful Eldrazi creatures and control the game until victory.

This deck focuses on quickly putting powerful creatures into play from the graveyard using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Psychic Frog. It also utilizes instant speed removal and counterspells like Force of Negation to protect its combo pieces. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition through reanimating threats like Emperor of Bones, Ulamog, the Defiler, and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. By combining graveyard recursion with control elements, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.
